Ready for your Charleston adventure? Whether you're visiting on a romantic getaway, a relaxed family vacation, or a historic adventure, 20 South Battery has a package or a sepcial that's perfect for you and specials curated just for you. Explore our offers and let the planning—and the excitement—begin!
Packages Romantic Getaway Package 
Sweeping views of the harbor, historic charm, and intimate moments await you. Surprise the one you love with an unforgettable getaway to Charleston's most romantic address on the historic Battery. This package is designed to help you connect and relax in a setting where every detail whispers romance.This package includes:

Chocolate Covered Strawberries

A bottle of Sparkling Wine

Late check-out (1pm) Based on Availability

Overnight accommodations
Book Now 
Indulge in a Charleston picnic experience like no other! This package offers a delightful escape with everything you need for a memorable outdoor adventure in one of the City's most historic locations. Relax on a cozy blanket and sip your favorite drinks from our exclusive "20 South Battery" tumblers. Choose between the serene privacy of our private garden or the iconic White Point Gardens, just steps away. Should the forecast call for rain, enjoy your picnic on our front Piazza. It's the perfect way to savor the beauty of Charleston and create lasting memories.This package includes:

Gourmet picnic basket filled with local cheeses, delectable Charleston treats, crackers, fresh fruit, and sparkling wine (or sparkling water, for those who prefer).

Picnic Blanket (yours to keep)

Two 20 South Battery Tumblers (take home to remember your time with us)

Overnight accommodations

Step outside our doors at 20 South Battery and into the pages of Charleston's past.With this self-guided tour package, the city becomes your living storybook. Follow your curiosity down beautiful streets and discover a history that unfolds with every step.This package includes:

Charleston’s Self-Guided Walking Tour Book

20 South Battery Tote to Carry all your findings

Walker’s Toolkit including Sunscreen, Bug Spray, snacks

Overnight accommodations

You won't just learn about the city's rich history—you'll experience it with a collection of expertly curated tours that bring Charleston's most captivating tales to life.This package includes:

Choose any two renowned Charleston Tours from the below list at a significant discount compared to you booking them yourselves.

Fort Sumter Tour

Ghosts of Charleston" Souvenir Book; written by Julian Buxton at Buxton Books. 20 South Battery's own Rooms 8 & 10 are spoken about in this book!

2 Tickets to a Walking Ghost Tour with our friends at Buxton Books.

Stay where history lives — plan your visit today.

Step into 20 South Battery, where Charleston’s past isn’t just preserved—it’s alive. This historic estate, with its 1845 Mansion, attached Carriage House and gardens, blends old-world craftsmanship with modern comfort. From the grand marble staircase and original Italian mosaic floors to the gilded Grand Ballroom—birthplace of Charleston’s preservation movement—you’re not just staying in a hotel; you’re stepping into living history.
Learn More Book Now Charleston’s Best, Right at Your Doorstep 
Step outside 20 South Battery and immerse yourself in all that Charleston has to offer. From the stunning waterfront views across the street at White Point Gardens to the historic beauty of The Battery, the city’s top attractions are just steps away. Take photos in front of the iconic Rainbow Row, indulge in world-class dining, or simply enjoy the scenic harbor views looking out towards Fort Sumter. Whatever brings you to Charleston, you’ll find it just outside our front doors or a short stroll away.
Learn More Book Now More Than a Stay — A Story 
Charleston boasts many beautiful hotels and inns, but 20 South Battery offers something unique: the chance to create memories within a luxurious estate and mansion filled with centuries of history. Native Charlestonian Dr. Jack Schaeffer restored this mansion with both reverence and wonder. He preserved its original architecture, uncovered rich historical details, and filled each room with authentic 19th-century antiques.Beyond the captivating interiors, you’ll discover our tranquil outdoor sanctuaries. Sip your morning coffee on our inviting porch or unwind for an afternoon in our beautiful, serene garden.
View Rooms Book Now 
The Experience

1845 historic mansion restored to its 1800s grandeur

Antique-filled rooms with modern comforts

Private library, formal garden, and newly revealed architectural details

Gourmet local breakfast each morning

Afternoon Social Hour in the Grand Ballroom with artisanal cheeses, charcuterie, and refreshments

Daily, personalized “living museum” tours

Guestrooms directly on the Battery overlooking White Point Garden

Dedicated concierge for bespoke Charleston experiences
Book Now 
What Our Guests Are Saying

20 South Battery is a WONDERFUL place to stay. From the location right across from Battery park, to the kind and accommodating staff, this inn felt like luxury personified.

- Christopher

Google

We loved this property for many reasons. All the staff we encountered were extremely gracious, helpful and professional. Our room was a suite. We each had a bathroom and separate closets as well. The antique four poster bed was large and comfortable. Our room opened onto the large and very quiet back garden. The property is filled with fine genuine antiques befitting a home of its kind. We enjoyed our breakfast every morning. All in all we considered it a privilege to be able to reside in this special location right on the Battery in Old Charleston. We are very grateful that Dr. Schaeffer bought and restored this fine place to share with those of us who truly appreciate the opportunity to experience Charleston’s delightful culture and past first hand.

- Janet

Tripadvisor

We just spent 4 fantastic nights at 20 South Battery and can't say enough good things about our time there. The mansion is a spectacular historical building and we felt very privileged to be able to see all of the beautiful furnishings and artwork along with getting a private tour of the building with Molly one afternoon. All of the staff there is ready to serve you with a smile. We stayed in one of the lower ground floor rooms and loved the peacefulness and privacy. There is so much to do and see within walking distance or just a short drive away. I would highly recommend staying here - you will definitely get 5 star treatment and truly feel like you have experienced Charleston in the way it was meant to be.

- Margaret

Trip Advisor

Do you want to have the real southern charm experience? Do you want to feel what Charleston is really like? This is the place to start. As soon as you walk in the front door you are taken back to the Antebellum heyday. I do a lot of research before I make my final lodging selection. I have rarely been disappointed and usually my choices are all close to a perfect match. This Inn was as close to perfect as you can get. I particularly love the ambiance of the communal breakfast experience. It is the perfect place to meet new people and share favorite destinations. And don’t forget to take the tour of the house. This house has stories.

- Gary

Google

Exceptional historic home turned B&B in the most heavenly little spot in Charleston! Staff were warm and welcoming with quick and easy check-in and checkout. We were guided on a lovely tour of the home as well (highly recommend this if time allows). The room was spacious and updated; extremely comfortable bedding was a major plus after a long travel day. It was a joy to sit on the front porch in the morning while enjoying the ocean breeze, watching horse drawn carriages trot by, and seeing all the visitors to come to see the beautiful park. This is truly a wonderful place to stay and one of few opportunities to stay in this area of the city; highly recommend 20 South Battery!

- Jill

Expedia

What a romantic stay in a spectacular location! The service was way above expectation. We were simply dazzled! The owner's preservation efforts were extraordinary, the property was made lavishly comfortable for guests, and the opportunity to "live" in an historic home that helped shape Charleston as we know it was an incredible treat.

- Heather
